page.title: 13Sikh Customs
page.content: The Sikh baptism was first introduced in 1699.A special nectar of sugar and water is made,stirred with a double edged sword,while 5 baptised Sikhs each say a prayer.5 palms full of amrit are given to the adult novice.He or she is given the name'Singh'_(lion) or 'Kaur'_(princess).For the Sikh bride,celebrations begin 2 days before the wedding.Oil and water are put on the floor and a pattern is sprinkled on top with flour.The bride sits on a chair while her face is covered with an orange mixture.On the day,the bride wears a red outfit,bangles and a ring on every finger.The groom and his relations (not his mother) meet the bride and family at the Gurudwara. After prayers,they walk around the canopy 4 times.After a party,money is pinned to their clothes.Later,they leave,to return the next day.
